reviews.review_msg: Great lecturer and you will learn tons of cell biology if you come to class and work on the questions he gives before exams; easy A. He is also a very personable and kind person. Very approachable and is a joy to have a conversation with in office hours.
Put in the work required and you'll get an A. Lots of readings

questions are given a week prior to exam(total 4 , none cumulative) and found them not hard to score on.quizzes are based on lectures while exams entirely on article readings. Recommend you make a study partner for preparing/checking your answers for exam. The only challenge were the presentations but by the last one i felt like a beast inside.

I had Dr. Silverman for MBB 221 as well as BISC 403. I was worried for 403 based on MBB and ratings on here, but he was completely different. You need to listen and take notes in class, but if you do you will do great on exams. You get to prepare answers which I found made the exams rather easy - I definitely recommend this class! :)

I had Dr. Silverman for both MBB 231 and BISC 403. While I found him to be hard in 231, 403 was a different story. In some ways, I think he prepares students for Upper Division courses which is why many people consider him to be hard. You can tell that he's truly dedicated in his work and really tries to help students learn. Recommended.

Despite all the negative reviews, I find Dr.Silverman to be an excellent prof. You can see from the way he lectures that he truly loves what he does and what he teaches. He is an extremely serious, professional and incredibly dedicated person who wants his students to learn. Never had a prof like this and I gotta say I'm really enjoying his class.

Don't take this class unless you like trolling around science databases reading about trafficking. Very grad student oriented. Prof speaks in great English but doesn't use microphone and so difficult to hear him. Expects too much from students. Grading system is too tough. Wouldn't take him again.

This prof is hard, he said it himself on the first day of classes: he expects 403 to be like a med school course..and his expectations are pretty high. Straight scales means 80 is a B, so kind of tough, gives the class the questions for the exam before hand but no indication of how to approach it. Tutorials way too much work.

Very full of himself and arrogant.  Likes to use big words to make himself look smart.  In some cases certain statements he made in lecture turned out to be dead wrong.  His conduct toward students is often rude and unprofessional. Stay away.

HE is the worst prof at SFU far by the most.  He simply does not know how to teach- I wonder where he got his phD. I do really think that he is full of himself.  his lectures are so boring. it will make you fall asleep. his tests are awful. his markng scheme is terrible. i wonder how he is still a prof.

He is too high on himself. Very arrogant, thinks he is the smartest dude around. The TA did not like me and I ended up with a lower grade. He does not choose the TAs wisely. Do not take this guy for any course.

if you want to fall asleep in class, be sure to take this class, lectures are very pointless and boring, has pictures on slides with no explanation, only good thing about the class is that he gives you the questions for the exam to take home.

His lectures were good overall. If he confuses us with one part he tries to make it clear next time.  His attitude towards students were very bad... He favors those who are working in a lab -_- gives us exam Q before but make sure to write a lot of details.
I really enjoyed going to his lectures.He's excellent!
Good guy, interesting lectures, articulate speaker. Recommended upper-level elective.

Silverman's got a Rennaissance kinda thing going on, but he comes across genuine, well-spoken and very intelligent.  If you listen to everything he says, do the readings, and participate in discussions, you can easily get 90%+.  He basically gives you exam questions beforehand, and you pick which ones you want to answer.  Highly recommended!

Straightforward notes and good teaching style.  Exams not tricky, just need to understand notes and journal articles.  Since topic, cell biology, is uncertain and developing on present basis, no text book, but informtion is from journal articles you need to read.
Fair exams since they're take home.Very intellectual guy.He really makes you listen in class.Love his old skool hair!!
